content: What type of creature is a Komodo dragon?

A Komodo dragon is a species of monitor lizard, specifically known as Varanus komodoensis. It is the largest living species of lizard, native to the Indonesian islands of Komodo, Rinca, Flores, and a few smaller ones. These reptiles can grow up to 10 feet in length and weigh around 150 pounds. They are carnivorous and have a unique hunting style, using their sharp teeth and venom to take down prey.
